channel.title: Avatars[suggestion]
channel.description: Why don't we have avatars? Why are they only enabled for mods. Can we get avatars? If you think no, then why not?

item.title: Avatars[suggestion]
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Elijah:

People who have avatars, have earned the right to have them.

And I think that is how it should stay without the site being cluttered up with avatars all over the place.

Read full topic

item.title: Avatars[suggestion]
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

People who have avatars, have earned the right to have them. Be a productive member of the community instead of complaining all the time and you could have one too. Even my dumb ass could see that.

Read full topic

item.title: Avatars[suggestion]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:39, topic:288393”]How it rise the workload?
Does anyone have a illegal avatar take from them the right to have it and give them some other punishment(Warning/Moderation/Mute) and the problem is solved.[/quote]

You have the x number of members with avatars. If one person abuses it and posts something bad, then the admins need to have to remove that. The more privileges you give to members, the more moderation and administration required.

[quote=“cocoa, post:40, topic:288393”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=381275.msg2867248#msg2867248 date=1247521689]
Or, the default setting could be to keep avatars disabled. But even so, avatars increase the workload of the admins by far too much. It would be too difficult to effectively moderate them.
[/quote]
You mean your workload? A lot of mods (on MSCP) tend to do nothing.[/quote]

Avatar administration is a special permission. It isn’t going to be given to a MoparScape mod, or even a global mod, anytime soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Avatars[suggestion]
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:36, topic:288393”][quote author=bowserjr2 link=topic=381275.msg2866295#msg2866295 date=1247485340]

Most people have stated the reason why avatars are not allowed. If you would like to see a real-life example head on over to sythe.org and look at just about any thread, it takes you 10x longer not only to load the page, but to sift through all of the stupid pictures to get to the actual content in the thread.

The forum looks much cleaner without images in avatars or signatures, and that is the way I want to keep it.

Images in signatures are I against too, have a limit on avatars like 100*100 and 10 KB, you max get 200 KB extra load on one page (Since the avatars are saved in Cache you only need to load each one once), most people won’t see the difference on speed, for those who only have dial-up or other reason won’t see them should have
the possibility to disable seeing them.
[/quote]

Loading the page on a modem would still take an extra 4 seconds per page, not to mention all the connections to see if the pictures have changed or not. In the end, it’s not really about speed, but how professional the forum looks, and I believe it looks best the way it is.[/quote]
Checked, it is possible to disable viewing of Avatars in the profile settings so that would not be any problem.
But one thing I can’t see is how this affect how professional the forum looks since it is a normal feature on forums, but if some should have it everybody should have it or disable it for everyone.

But it is your choose, do whatever you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Avatars[suggestion]
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:27, topic:288393”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=381275.msg2865482#msg2865482 date=1247443344]
Most people have stated the reason why avatars are not allowed. If you would like to see a real-life example head on over to sythe.org and look at just about any thread, it takes you 10x longer not only to load the page, but to sift through all of the stupid pictures to get to the actual content in the thread.

The forum looks much cleaner without images in avatars or signatures, and that is the way I want to keep it.
[/quote]
Images in signatures are I against too, have a limit on avatars like 100*100 and 10 KB, you max get 200 KB extra load on one page (Since the avatars are saved in Cache you only need to load each one once), most people won’t see the difference on speed, for those who only have dial-up or other reason won’t see them should have
the possibility to disable seeing them.[/quote]

Loading the page on a modem would still take an extra 4 seconds per page, not to mention all the connections to see if the pictures have changed or not. In the end, it’s not really about speed, but how professional the forum looks, and I believe it looks best the way it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Avatars[suggestion]
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:33, topic:288393”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=381275.msg2866619#msg2866619 date=1247503775]

Not to mention, they are utterly pointless and as anyone can see from the other points brought up here, have many disadvantages.

Why not remove these icons then and just have it say Java Guru?

Because it makes them standout for what they accomplished.

Yes, some ugly-ass avatar has no meaning.

Duke is not ugly

That’s not an avatar… that’s an award…
[/quote]

Are you trying to correct yourself?[/quote]
No? I was never referring to the awards.

T4_:

Yes, some ugly-ass avatar has no meaning.

Read full topic
